iana.encoding_considerations:
Security considerations: See 10.2 Context Interception and Tampering, 
   10.6 JSON Parsing, 10.7 JSON-LD Expansion, and 11.1 Context 
   Fetching in the published specification/

Interoperability considerations: See RFC 8259.

   Rules for processing both conforming and non-conforming content 
   are defined in this specification.

iana.applications:
the W3C Web of Things, that is, Things, Consumers, and 
   Intermediaries as defined in the W3C Web of Things (WoT) 
   Architecture 1.1 document: https://www.w3.org/TR/wot-architecture11/

   extension)
   Macintosh file type code(s): TEXT
iana.template_text:
(registered 2022-08-22, last updated 2022-08-22)

Type name: application

Subtype name: tm+json

Required parameters: None

Optional parameters: None

Encoding considerations: See RFC 6839, section 3.1.

Security considerations: See 10.2 Context Interception and Tampering, 
   10.6 JSON Parsing, 10.7 JSON-LD Expansion, and 11.1 Context 
   Fetching in the published specification/

Interoperability considerations: See RFC 8259.

   Rules for processing both conforming and non-conforming content 
   are defined in this specification.

Published specification:

   W3C Web of Things (WoT) Thing Description 1.1:
   https://www.w3.org/TR/wot-thing-description11/

Applications that use this media type: All participating entities in 
   the W3C Web of Things, that is, Things, Consumers, and 
   Intermediaries as defined in the W3C Web of Things (WoT) 
   Architecture 1.1 document: https://www.w3.org/TR/wot-architecture11/

Fragment identifier considerations: See RFC 6901, section 3 and 
   section 6. Note that reserved characters may be percent encoded.

Additional information:

   Magic number(s): Not Applicable
   File extension(s): .jsontm, .tm.json, .tm.jsonld (preferred file 
   extension)
   Macintosh file type code(s): TEXT

Person & email address to contact for further information:
   Sebastian.Kaebisch&siemens.com

Intended usage: COMMON

Restrictions on usage: None

Author(s): The Web of Things (WoT) Thing Description specification is 
   a product of the Web of Things Working Group.

Change controller: W3C
